body.p: To His Excellency Beriah MaGoffin Govenor of the Commonwealth of Ky

Your petitioner William Beckett would most respectfully represent unto your Excellency, that on the day of 1861 a warrant was issued by Granvill L Merrill an acting Justice of the Peace for Whitley County against your petition charging him with the offence of carrying concealed deadly weapons, and on the 21 day of this month (Jany 1861) he appeared before said Justice and entered his plea of guilty and a fine of fifty dollars was assesed against him, He says that it is true he carried a pistol, but the same was done under the following circumstances that during Christmas, the young men of Williamsburg were on what is commonally called a bust and your petitioner among the number desirous of having some amusement had the pistol to do some shooting where they might to get out to themselves in a private place

He says that he did not carry the pistol concealed and only had the same during the christmas holidays, He says that he never would have been chage with such an offence but for the malicious feeling of a young gentleman of this neighborhood who is always ready and anxious to be extremley officious and cannot in every little low plunge in thing that may happen in the community. He says that he is a very poor young man and has to make his liveing by the sweat of his brow the premises considered he pray your Excellency may extend to him the arm of your Executive clemency and he prays for a remission of the fine
We the undersigned citizens of Whitly County would like to see your Excellency to remit, the above fine against Mr Beckett

R Boyd
J. D, Gilliss
Lee Leforce
E. J. King
A. C. King
W. H. Wilson
H. F. Finley

I hope your excellency will remit the fine against Mr Becket he has been living here for some time is a verry industrious young man & he has never had any difficulty with any person and always behaved himself like a gentleman

Whitley J P
Remitted
B. M
$50 } Weapons
Wm Beckett
Issd Jany 30 1861
